Posts.Content: I've been on it for about 18 months. My biggest complaint is the joint pain in knees and hips and the fact that I feel like I'm 90 years old. I was post menopausal when I started. My BC was invasive lobular carcinoma, Stage 1, Grade 1, 1 cm in size, no lymph node involvement. I did not have to have chemo or radiation. I feel very blessed. I've been reading What Your Doctor May Not Have Told You About Breast Cancer by Dr. John R. Lee. I'm just not convinced the Letrozole is really necessary or going to make that much of a differnece in recurrance possibility. I'm just trying to weigh all my options.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer. Stopped Letrozole. Side Effects. Hair Loss
Breast Cancer. Stopped Letrozole. Side Effects. Hair Loss

Posts.Content: I haven't experienced hair loss, but I want to get off the Letrozole. Did you just stop cold turkey, or did you wean yourself off of it? Thanks,
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer. Stopped Letrozole. Side Effects. Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Yes, I just recently had a bone density test and now have Ostoporsis in my spine. Grrrrrr. So frustrating. Thanks for sharing your comments. I'm learning that it is a journey.
